metadata.Title: CVE-2019-15215 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - low
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.2.6. There is ause-after-free caused by a malicious USB device in thedrivers/media/usb/cpia2/cpia2_usb.c driver.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15215` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67
No subscription required

linux-image-5.0.0-31-generic - 5.0.0-31.33~18.04.1
